Integrating the Composable Architecture into a SwiftUI application.

The Composable Architecture (TCA, for short) is a library for building applications in a consistent
and understandable way, with composition, testing, and ergonomics in mind. It can be used in
SwiftUI, UIKit, and more, and on any Apple platform (iOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS).
Helps implement the conformance to the
protocol for a type.
Transform a reducer’s dependency value at the specified key path with the given function.
Learn about one of the most fundamental tools in the Composable Architecture: the reducer. It is
responsible for evolving the state of your application forward when an action is sent, and
constructing effects that are executed in the outside world.

for alerts
and confirmation dialogs that does not require a child reducer.
A protocol that describes how to evolve the current state of an application to the next state,
given an action, and describes what
s should be executed later by the store, if any.
